wikipedia_page.main: Ian Black (born 4 February 1960) is a Scottish former professional footballer who played as a full back in the Scottish Football League for Hearts, Hibernian, East Fife and Berwick Rangers.

response: It was reported in The Scotsman newspaper on 24 December 2008 that Black had agreed in principle to sign a pre-contract agreement to join boyhood heroes Heart of Midlothian in the summer of 2009.Hearts sign Black on pre-contract, The Scotsman, 24 December 2008. Hearts confirmed that he had signed the agreement on 28 December and would join up with the club for the 2009–10 season.inewsDetail/0,,10289~1501707,00.html Ian Black to join Hearts, Heart of Midlothian F.C., 28 December 2008. On 2 July 2009, Black finally signed for Hearts after signing a pre-contract agreement in December 2008, marking a return to the club he once served as a ball boy. He made his debut on 17 August 2009 as a substitute against Dundee United at Tannadice, with his first start coming on 23 August against Rangers. He scored his first goal for Hearts on 13 February 2010 with a long-range effort against Falkirk in a 3–2 win. In his first season with the club he made 32 appearances in all competitions, scoring once.
